intro: Cyrtandra macrodiscus, commonly known as the broad disk Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, berry-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
